bibl.author: William Michael Rossetti
bibl.title: William Michael Rossetti to Walt Whitman, 4 April 1876
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

revisionDesc.change: made basic checking changes to file

body.p: I write in haste, & specially for the business purpose named further on. Mrs. Gilchrist & Dowden (who happens just now to be in London) have seen your letter of 17 March, & doubtless appreciated it as I do. I have received also your post-card of 20 March, & the Two Rivulets wh.which that announced.

What I want to know is the precise fact about the prices &c of your books. The printed slip mentions only Leaves of Grass £1 ($5), Two Rivulets £1, Mem.Memoranda during war 6/—, & all 3 for £2; & of each of these only 100 copies printed. Is it a fact then that a L.Leaves of Grass is not anyhow obtainable at less than £1 nowadays? & that, when 100 copies are sold no more purchasers need apply? w.dwould you kindly tell me precisely about
all this. Were it not that I find the uncertainty about this most embarrassing, & the presumable chance of enlisting purchasers at such high prices much diminished, I shdshould already have drawn up my proposed circular to start the scheme. Perhaps you w.dwould prefer to telegraph back in fewest words: note this as you prefer.
Your poems printed in Athenaeum of 1 April.
Some minor details when next I write.

postscript.p:
Please tell me also how you
w.dwould like me to send over the various sums I have received for your books. I presume you w.dwould send the books direct to the purchasers: not but that I w.dwould receive & distribute them if really any object to you, but it w.dwould cause delay to all, & to me some work of a kind at wh.which I am not particularly ready.
